basics.name: Alankrit Singh
basics.summary: Computer Science undergraduate at BITS Pilani, Goa, with research interests in AI, Machine Learning, and Autonomous Systems. Currently working on autonomous driving behavior modeling and neural genomics of AI models.

work.summary: Contributed to the Intelligent Data Pipeline project for scalable GenAI-ready NLP data processing. Migrated pipeline infrastructure from Google Cloud to Azure, enabling dataset curation for LLM training.
highlights: Migrated pipeline infrastructure from Google Cloud to Azure
Enabled dataset curation for LLM training
Worked on scalable GenAI-ready NLP data processing

education.institution: Birla Institute of Technology and Science (BITS Pilani)
education.area: Bachelor of Engineering in Computer Science

teaching.description: Designed and conducted tutorials and homework assignments on deep learning concepts for undergraduate and graduate students and evaluated student submissions.

portfolio.name: LLMExam: AI-Driven Question Paper Generation
portfolio.description: Developed a multimodal system using a local VLM (Qwen2.5-VL) to automatically extract textual questions, diagrams, and graphs from PDFs. Employed vector search for topic-based retrieval and designed an LLM-driven topic tagging mechanism for precise question classification.

portfolio.name: Zero-Shot Learning using RoBERTa
portfolio.description: Enhanced classification accuracy by iteratively optimizing label prompts using generative language models (Gemma2-9B, Qwen2.5-32B, and Nemotron-70B). Improved performance metrics, achieving a significant increase in accuracy from 48.5% to 82.13% with Nemotron-70B.

portfolio.name: MonetAI: Generating Artistic Images using GANs
portfolio.description: Developed a generative model replicating Claude Monet's artistic style using CycleGANs.
